intro: Dracula lafleurii, commonly known as the "Lafleur’s Dragon" or "Dragon's Blood," is a rare and striking orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its vivid red and orange flowers, which resemble the scales of a dragon, giving it its dramatic common name. The plant belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its intricate, spurred petals and unique floral structure. It thrives in high-altitude, humid environments with dappled sunlight and well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Dracula lafleurii is considered a conservation concern.
